channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Wall Street wanted a September rate cut—instead it got a ‘baby step’ and stocks are hurting as a result
item.description: "I am skeptical that the key economic data over the next seven weeks are going to add to the FOMC’s confidence."

item.title: Nvidia reportedly faces a U.S. DOJ antitrust probe after complaints from rivals
item.description: The U.S. Department of Justice is investigating complaints that Nvidia allegedly abused its market dominance in AI chips, The Information reported.

item.title: The Nasdaq 100 has entered correction territory
British Airways sees travel demand take off, but parent IAG kills bid for Air Europa after EU scrutiny
item.description: The airline has reintroduced its first dividend payment since the start of the Covid pandemic.

item.title: Exxon earnings beat as production in Guyana and Permian sets a record
item.description: ExxonMobil on Friday posted its second highest results for the second quarter in the past decade, helped by record production in Guyana and the Permian Basin.

item.title: Gold futures reach new record at over $2,500 an ounce
It’s not just you: Simone Biles has destigmatized mental health leave for millions of women
item.description: In Tokyo, Biles showed she was brave enough to put herself first. In Paris, she proved she was able to come back stronger.

item.title: Chevron earnings miss on lower refining margins, relocates headquarters to Houston
item.description: The results come as the Chevron-Hess deal is delayed until well into 2025 due to an arbitration case with ExxonMobil.

item.title: British Airways owner returns to paying dividends for first time since pandemic
Instagram blocked by Turkish government over its censorship of eulogies for killed Hamas leader
item.description: Hamas political chief Ismail Haniyeh was known to be a close friend of Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan.

item.title: Friday's analyst calls: Big Tech earnings reaction, Morgan Stanley gets a downgrade
item.description: Major tech-related stocks and a big bank were among the stock being talked about on Wall Street on Friday.

item.title: Hulbert: 16 stocks to exploit August’s explosive election-year gains
Taxi drivers in France demand payout after months of Olympic gridlock in Paris
item.description: Some taxi drivers reported their income had nearly halved over the last seven months.

item.title: Intel shares plunge 21% in premarket trading, Nvidia down 3.5% as global chip stocks fall
item.description: Asian stocks including Samsung and TSMC closed lower as European chip firms including ASML also dropped.

item.title: Poletti: It’s time for Nvidia to replace Intel in the Dow
